remoteDiagnosis.title: XENTRY Remote Diagnosis
remoteDiagnosis.subtitle: Advanced remote diagnostic service for Mercedes-Benz vehicles with telematic systems

what.title: What is XENTRY Remote Diagnosis?
what.description: XENTRY Remote Diagnosis is a digital platform developed by Mercedes-Benz that enables precise real-time diagnostics through the vehicle's telematic connectivity. The system provides direct access to main modules and electronic systems of the vehicle.
what.capability1: Receive detailed information about the vehicle's condition
what.capability2: Monitor system data like fluid levels, tire pressure, battery status and more
what.capability3: Provide recommendations for necessary repairs or service activities

advantages.title: Advantages for Customers
advantages.subtitle: Experience the benefits of modern connected vehicle diagnostics

adv1.title: Remote Diagnostics
adv1.description: No need to drive to the service center for initial checks - we can perform diagnostics remotely through the vehicle's internet connectivity.

adv2.title: Speed & Convenience
adv2.description: When deeper inspection is needed, it can be done on-site at the service center, but preliminary information allows us to prepare and reduce service time.

adv3.title: Precise Information
adv3.description: Thanks to the system, we receive the most current and accurate information directly from the vehicle, improving repair accuracy.

adv4.title: Time Optimization
adv4.description: Reduced downtime at the service center and faster service delivery. Take care of your vehicle without worrying about time and difficulties.

adv5.title: Modern Customer Experience
adv5.description: High-tech approach provides customers with greater peace of mind and control over their vehicle's condition.

models.title: Supported Models
models.description: XENTRY Remote Diagnosis is available for newer Mercedes-Benz models supporting telematic functions, primarily from series produced after 2020 and equipped with Mercedes me services.

digitalServiceBooklet.title: Digital Service Booklet (DSB)
digitalServiceBooklet.subtitle: Your electronic service history in the Mercedes-Benz system

what.title: What is DSB?
what.description: Since 2008, all Mercedes-Benz vehicles have a Digital Service Booklet (DSB) - an official manufacturer database storing all information about service and repairs performed on the vehicle.
what.point1: All data is stored directly in the Mercedes-Benz system
what.point2: Information is accessible to any authorized service center or employee with system access
what.point3: Complete service history of the vehicle can be tracked at any time
what.point4: Service is visible for future diagnostics or repairs at other service centers domestically or abroad

periodicMaintenance.title: Periodic Maintenance Services
periodicMaintenance.subtitle: Complete and certified service for your Mercedes according to all manufacturer standards

intro.title: Professional Service According to Mercedes-Benz Standards
intro.p1: We perform all types of periodic and recommended services, as well as in-depth inspections and service activities, in accordance with the highest Mercedes-Benz standards. We don't just service your vehicle - we maintain it exactly as intended by the manufacturer.
intro.p2: We fully comply with the vehicle dashboard indications, including service codes and current mileage, which indicate necessary service. Based on the service code and actual mileage, we determine mandatory activities that must be performed according to the manufacturer's technical documentation. All recommendations and actions are based on Mercedes-Benz's WIS (Workshop Information System).
intro.p3: For newer vehicles with activated telematics and connectivity, we can remotely extract service information directly from the manufacturer's online system to offer the most accurate and timely service.

periodic.title: Periodic Services
periodic.s1: Engine oil and oil filter replacement
periodic.s2: Air, fuel, and cabin filter replacement
periodic.s3: Spark plug replacement and ignition system check (for gasoline engines)
periodic.s4: Cooling system, antifreeze, and thermostat check
periodic.s5: Check and top-up of all working fluids (brake, steering, transmission, etc.)
periodic.s6: Brake, suspension, tire, headlight, and light check
periodic.s7: Wiper blade replacement, nozzle and air conditioning check

manual.title: Manual Transmission Service

Every step - from diagnostics to final test - is performed strictly according to manufacturer standards.
guarantee.p2: We use only high-quality oils, consumables, and auto parts meeting all Mercedes-Benz requirements and certifications. This guarantees not only flawless system operation but also warranty preservation and long-term vehicle reliability.

header.title: SERVICE TERMS AND CONDITIONS
header.subtitle: of "MB Center" Ltd.
header.address:

art1.title: Art. 1.
art1.content: These Terms and Conditions constitute an internal normative act governing the relations between "MB Center" Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as the "Contractor" or the "Service Center") and its customers (hereinafter referred to as the "Clients") in connection with the provision of service activities, repairs, and technical maintenance of Mercedes-Benz vehicles.

art2.title: Art. 2.
art2.p1: (1) These Terms and Conditions are binding and apply to every service card, report, or repair contract.
art2.p2: (2) By signing the service card, the Client declares consent with all clauses, paragraphs, items, and sub-items contained in this document.

ii.title: Chapter II. Personal Data Protection Policy

art3.title: Art. 3. General provisions and categories of data
art3.p1: (1) This policy regulates the order, conditions, principles, and procedures under which "MB Center" Ltd. collects, processes, stores, uses, and protects personal data of its customers, clients, representatives, employees, and third parties.
art3.p2: (2) The policy is drafted in accordance with applicable legislation, including the General Data Protection Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2016/679 – GDPR), the Personal Data Protection Act, and all secondary regulations.
art3.p3: (3) The Service Center may process the following categories of personal data:

dataCategories.1: Item 1. Identification data: full name, Personal Identification Number (EGN), UIC, ID card number, address;
dataCategories.2: Item 2. Contact data: phone number, email, postal address;
dataCategories.3: Item 3. Vehicle data: registration number, VIN, model, technical characteristics;
dataCategories.4: Item 4. Financial data: information on payments, invoices, bank accounts;
dataCategories.5: Item 5. Data voluntarily provided by the customer in communication with the Service Center.

purposes.1: Item 1. Customer identification upon vehicle acceptance;
purposes.2: Item 2. Preparation of service cards, reports, and invoices;
purposes.4: Item 4. Communication with the customer regarding repair, timelines, and payments;
purposes.5: Item 5. Compliance with legal obligations (accounting, tax, regulatory);
purposes.6: Item 6. Protection of the rights and legitimate interests of the Service Center.

art3.p5: (5) The Client agrees that every paragraph, item, and sub-item of this article is binding, regardless of its length, complexity, or repetitiveness.

art4.title: Art. 4. Retention, rights, and liability
art4.p1: (1) Personal data is stored for periods determined by law, including tax and accounting requirements.
art4.p2: (2) After the relevant periods expire, the data is destroyed or anonymized.

rights.3: Item 3. To erasure ("right to be forgotten");

art4.p4: (4) The Service Center is responsible for lawful processing of personal data and applies technical and organizational measures for protection, including encryption, access restriction, and archiving.
art4.p5: (5) The Client is responsible for providing false or incomplete data.
art4.p6: (6) Violations of this policy may lead to refusal of service or claims for compensation.
art4.p7: (7) This chapter may be amended and supplemented at any time by the Service Center, and the amendment enters into force upon publication on the website.
art4.p8: (8) The Client agrees that reading this chapter is mandatory, regardless of its volume, complexity, or repetitiveness.

art5.title: Art. 5. Granting, scope, and limitations of the warranty
art5.p1: (1) The Contractor provides a warranty for the repair work performed and spare parts installed, and the warranty constitutes a contractual obligation with the force of law between the parties.
art5.p2: (2) The warranty period is as follows:

warrantyPeriods.1: Item 1. For vehicles owned by legal entities (company vehicles) – 1 (one) year from the date of issuance of the service card;
warrantyPeriods.2: Item 2. For vehicles owned by individuals (private customers) – 2 (two) years from the date of issuance of the service card.

art5.p3: (3) The warranty covers only the specific repair activities and spare parts described in the service card and may not be extended by interpretation or analogy to other vehicle elements.
art5.p4: (4) The warranty is non-transferable and may not be assigned, pledged, or otherwise disposed of by the Client.
art5.p5: (5) The warranty is automatically void, without the need for additional notice, in the following cases:

voidConditions.1: Item 1. The vehicle has been serviced, repaired, or modified in a service center other than the Contractor;
voidConditions.2: Item 2. External intervention, modification, or tuning exists that directly or indirectly affects the repairs performed;
voidConditions.3: Item 3. The Client has not complied with the operating, maintenance, and service recommendations provided;
voidConditions.4: Item 4. The vehicle has been used under conditions incompatible with the manufacturer's technical instructions (including racing, off-road use, overloading beyond permissible parameters);
voidConditions.5: Item 5. The Client has used non-original oils, fluids, or consumables that have caused damage.

art5.p6: (6) The Client bears the burden of proof to establish that the warranty conditions have been met by presenting the service card, invoice, and other relevant documents.

exclusions.1: Item 1. Cosmetic defects, external remarks, and minor non-conformities that do not affect the functionality of the repair;
exclusions.2: Item 2. Damage caused by traffic accidents, natural disasters, vandalism, or other force majeure circumstances;
exclusions.3: Item 3. Hidden factory defects of the vehicle that were not the subject of the repair;
exclusions.4: Item 4. Wear and tear resulting from normal use.

art5.p8: (8) The warranty may not be interpreted as insurance coverage or as assumption of liability for all future vehicle defects.

art6.title: Art. 6. Procedure, termination, and disputes
art6.p1: (1) When making a warranty claim, the Client must present the vehicle at the Contractor's service center for inspection and diagnostics.
art6.p2: (2) The Contractor may refuse warranty service if it finds that the conditions under Art. 5 have not been met.
art6.p3: (3) If the claim is justified, the repair is performed free of charge using parts and materials that meet the manufacturer's standards.
art6.p4: (4) If the claim is unjustified, the Client owes payment for the incurred diagnostics and inspection costs.
art6.p5: (5) The warranty terminates automatically upon expiry of the relevant period under Art. 5(2).
art6.p6: (6) The warranty may not be extended or renewed unless explicitly agreed in writing between the parties.
art6.p7: (7) All disputes arising in connection with warranty services are resolved by mutual agreement; failing that, under the applicable laws of the Republic of Bulgaria.
art6.p8: (8) This clause aims to protect the Service Center from claims arising from external interventions and to ensure the warranty applies only under conditions where the repair was performed and controlled by the Service Center.

iv.title: Chapter IV. Vehicle Handover and Objections Policy

art7.title: Art. 7.
art7.p1: (1) Upon handover of the vehicle after repair, the Client must perform an immediate inspection of the vehicle.
art7.p2: (2) Any objections regarding performed work or cosmetic remarks must be stated immediately at handover.
art7.p3: (3) After the vehicle is handed over and the respective documents are signed, the Client has no right to raise objections regarding cosmetic defects, external remarks, or other minor non-conformities.

v.title: Chapter V. Storage and Parking Policy

art8.title: Art. 8.
art8.p1: (1) Vehicles left at the Service Center are stored with due care within the indoor premises of the Contractor.
art8.p2: (2) The Contractor is not liable for damage, loss, or missing items occurring to vehicles left on the outdoor parking area outside the guarded and controlled areas of the Service Center.
art8.p3: (3) The Client accepts that leaving a vehicle on the outdoor parking area is at the Client's own risk and responsibility.

vi.title: Chapter VI. Spare Parts and Materials Policy

art9.title: Art. 9.
art9.p1: (1) The Contractor uses original or certified spare parts in accordance with the manufacturer's standards.
art9.p2: (2) Alternative parts may be used only with the Client's explicit written consent.

art10.title: Art. 10.
art10.content: All spare parts installed in the repair are invoiced separately and are subject to warranty under Art. 5.

art11.title: Art. 11.
art11.p1: (1) The Contractor is liable for the quality of the repairs performed within the warranty period.
art11.p2: (2) The Contractor is not liable for:

exclusions.1: Item 1. Defects arising from improper use;
exclusions.2: Item 2. Damage caused by external factors (accidents, natural disasters, vandalism, etc.);
exclusions.3: Item 3. Hidden factory defects of the vehicle;
exclusions.4: Item 4. Malfunctions arising from the use of non-original parts, oils, or consumables.

viii.title: Chapter VIII. Payments and Financial Terms

art12.title: Art. 12.
art12.p1: (1) The Client must pay the cost of the repair according to the issued invoice.
art12.p2: (2) Payment may be made in cash, by bank transfer, or via other methods approved by the Contractor.

art13.title: Art. 13.
art13.content: In case of delayed payment, statutory interest is charged for each overdue day in accordance with Art. 86 of the Obligations and Contracts Act.

ix.title: Chapter IX. Policy on Refusal of Services

art14.title: Art. 14.
art14.p1: (1) The Client may refuse performance of the repair until work has commenced.
art14.p2: (2) In the event of refusal after the repair has started, the Client owes payment for the work already performed and parts used.

art15.title: Art. 15.
art15.p1: (1) Complaints are accepted only in written form, accompanied by the service card and invoice.
art15.p2: (2) The Contractor must review the complaint within 14 days.
art15.p3: (3) If the complaint is justified, the repair is performed free of charge under warranty.
art15.p4: (4) If the complaint is unjustified, the Client owes payment for the diagnostics costs incurred.

xi.title: Chapter XI. Storage and Test Drive Policy

art16.title: Art. 16.
art16.p1: (1) Vehicles left at the Service Center are stored with due care and supervision within the indoor premises of the Contractor.
art16.p2: (2) The Contractor is not liable for damage, loss, or missing items resulting from force majeure, natural disasters, vandalism, or other external factors beyond its control.
art16.p3: (3) Vehicles left on the outdoor parking area are entirely at the Client's risk and responsibility, and the Contractor bears no property or contractual liability for their condition.

art17.title: Art. 17.
art17.p1: (1) For the purpose of verifying repairs performed and diagnosing the vehicle's technical condition, the Contractor may perform a test drive of the vehicle.
art17.p2: (2) By signing the service card, the Client gives explicit consent for the test drive, which is carried out in compliance with all traffic rules.
art17.p3: (3) The Contractor is not liable for damage resulting from hidden factory defects or malfunctions manifested during the test drive.

xii.title: Chapter XII. Deposits and Parts Ordering Policy

art18.title: Art. 18.
art18.p1: (1) When requesting a repair involving delivery and installation of spare parts, the Client may be required to pay a deposit representing partial or full advance payment for the parts.
art18.p2: (2) The deposit serves as security for performance of the order and is non-refundable in the event of a unilateral refusal by the Client, regardless of the reason.
art18.p3: (3) Refund of the deposit is permitted only if the Contractor is objectively unable to fulfill the order due to lack of availability, discontinuation of the part, or other circumstances beyond its control.
art18.p4: (4) In case of refund, the Contractor must return the amount within 30 (thirty) calendar days from the occurrence of the respective circumstance, via the same method as paid, unless otherwise agreed in writing.
art18.p5: (5) The Contractor may set off the refundable amount against any due and liquid obligations of the Client arising from other agreements, repairs, parts deliveries, or services.
art18.p6: (6) The set-off is deemed completed from the moment the Client is notified in writing, and mutual obligations are extinguished up to the amount of the smaller sum.
art18.p7: (7) By signing the service card or repair contract, the Client declares they are aware of and agree to this policy on deposits, refunds, and set-off.

xiii.title: Chapter XIII. Policy on Price Changes

art19.title: Art. 19.
art19.p1: (1) If additional necessary activities are identified during the repair, the Service Center may propose an adjustment to the initially agreed price.
art19.p2: (2) If the Client refuses the additional activities, the Client declares they are aware of and accept the risk of subsequent damage that will not be covered by warranty.

xiv.title: Chapter XIV. Policy on Refused Repair

art20.title: Art. 20.
art20.p1: (1) If the Client insists on a partial repair, replacement of only one part of a set, or refuses a repair recommended by the Service Center, the warranty on the performed work is void.
art20.p2: (2) The Client bears full responsibility for any subsequent damage resulting from an incomplete or refused repair.

xv.title: Chapter XV. Policy on Risk in Software Interventions

art21.title: Art. 21.
art21.p1: (1) When performing updates, reprogramming, or adaptation of electronic modules (including SBC, 7G-Tronic, 9G, ECU, TCU, ESP, Airbag, Gateway, and others), there is a risk of failure of already compromised components.
art21.p2: (2) The Client accepts and declares that modules may fail due to age, corrosion, internal factory defects, or other objective reasons for which the Service Center bears no liability.

xvi.title: Chapter XVI. Service Center's Right to Refuse Service

art22.title: Art. 22.
art22.p1: (1) The Service Center may refuse to perform repair or maintenance in the following cases:

cases.1: Item 1. Unauthorized tuning or modifications compromising safety;
cases.2: Item 2. Dangerous technical condition of the vehicle that may endanger the life and health of employees or third parties;
cases.3: Item 3. Aggressive, disrespectful, or humiliating behavior by the Client toward staff;
cases.4: Item 4. Suspicion of illegal modifications or activities contrary to the law.

xvii.title: Chapter XVII. Installation of Parts Provided by the Client

art23.title: Art. 23.
art23.p1: (1) When installing spare parts provided by the Client, the Service Center is not liable for defects caused by the quality or origin of those parts.
art23.p2: (2) In such cases, no warranty is provided for the labor performed, and the Client assumes the risk of subsequent damage.

art24.title: Art. 24.
art24.p1: (1) The Service Center premises are under continuous video surveillance (24/7).
art24.p2: (2) By being present on the premises, the Client is considered informed of and consenting to the video surveillance, which aims to protect property and security.

xix.title: Chapter XIX. Risk Policy in Forced Disassembly

art25.title: Art. 25.
art25.p1: (1) If disassembly of seized, stuck, or corroded components results in breakage, deformation, or other damage, the Client assumes the risk and may not bring claims against the Service Center.
art25.p2: (2) The Service Center must inform the Client of the risk prior to performing the disassembly.

xx.title: Chapter XX. Policy on Termination of Relations

art26.title: Art. 26.
art26.p1: (1) The Service Center may terminate servicing a Client for operational, ethical, or legal reasons, including but not limited to:

reasons.1: Item 1. Systematic non-payment of financial obligations;
reasons.2: Item 2. Behavior that violates good morals or endangers employees;
reasons.3: Item 3. Illegal modifications or activities related to the vehicle;
reasons.4: Item 4. Other circumstances that objectively prevent normal performance of service activities.

art26.p2: (2) Termination is effected by written notice; from that moment the Service Center bears no obligations for future repairs or servicing.

xxi.title: Chapter XXI. Access to the Service Area

art27.title: Art. 27.
art27.p1: (1) Access by customers and third parties to the service area is strictly restricted.
art27.p2: (2) The Client may not be present during repair activities unless expressly invited by the Service Center.

purposes.1: Item 1. Ensure the safety of employees and customers;
purposes.3: Item 3. Prevent unauthorized interference in the repair process.

art28.title: Art. 28. General provisions
art28.p1: (1) The Service Center may test drive a vehicle to verify performed repair work and diagnose the technical condition.
art28.p2: (2) Test drives are performed only by authorized Service Center employees.

art29.title: Art. 29. Conditions for performance
art29.p1: (1) Test driving is carried out within a reasonable mileage necessary for verification.
art29.p2: (2) All test drives are performed in compliance with traffic rules and internal safety rules.
art29.p3: (3) The Client gives explicit consent for test driving upon acceptance of the vehicle at the Service Center.

art30.title: Art. 30. Liability
art30.p1: (1) The Service Center is liable for the vehicle during the test drive, except in force majeure circumstances.
art30.p2: (2) The Client accepts that if hidden defects or compromised components manifest during the test drive, the Service Center is not liable for their occurrence.
art30.p3: (3) The Service Center will not test drive a vehicle if its condition poses a danger to traffic or employees.
art30.p4: (4) The Client bears full responsibility for the availability and validity of mandatory documents and insurance, including:

documents.3: Item 3. Any other documents required by law.

art30.p5: (5) If during a test drive the vehicle is stopped by authorities and missing/irregular documents are found, all fines, costs, or administrative sanctions (including temporary suspension of the employee's driving license) are at the Client's expense.

xxiii.title: Chapter XXIII. Deadlines and Delays Policy

art31.title: Art. 31. General provisions
art31.p1: (1) Repair timelines stated by the Service Center are indicative.
art31.p2: (2) They are determined based on information available at vehicle acceptance and may be changed due to objective circumstances.

art32.title: Art. 32. Reasons for delay

reasons.2: Item 2. Discovery of additional technical issues;

art32.p2: (2) In such cases, the Service Center may extend the repair timeline without liability for indirect damages or lost profits.

art33.title: Art. 33. Liability
art33.p1: (1) The Service Center is not liable for delays caused by reasons beyond its control.
art33.p2: (2) The Client accepts that an extension does not constitute non-performance by the Service Center.
art33.p3: (3) The Service Center owes no compensation for delay.

art34.title: Art. 34. General provisions
art34.p1: (1) Vehicles are complex technical systems consisting of many interconnected mechanical, electrical, and electronic components.
art34.p2: (2) Diagnostics is a staged and systematic process, and each step may reveal new data that changes initial conclusions.
art34.p3: (3) The Client accepts that diagnostics is not a one-time conclusion but a dynamic process of establishing the vehicle's actual technical condition.

art35.title: Art. 35. Diagnostics process
art35.p1: (1) Diagnostics is performed through a combination of:

methods.1: Item 1. Electronic tests and software checks;
methods.2: Item 2. Visual inspections and mechanical measurements;
methods.3: Item 3. Road tests and functional checks.

art35.p2: (2) Each stage may lead to correction or supplementation of earlier conclusions.
art35.p3: (3) The Service Center may update the repair quote depending on subsequent diagnostic results.

art36.title: Art. 36. Liability and limitations
art36.p1: (1) The Service Center is not liable for changes in initial conclusions after additional checks—this is a natural part of the work process.
art36.p2: (2) The Client accepts that a change in diagnosis does not constitute an "error" but a normal development of the diagnostic process.
art36.p3: (3) All costs for additional checks and corrections are borne by the Client unless gross negligence by the Service Center is proven.
art36.p4: (4) The Service Center is not liable for indirect damages or lost profits arising from a change in diagnosis.

art37.title: Art. 37. Additional provisions
art37.p1: (1) This policy aims to ensure transparency and clarity, emphasizing that diagnostics is a process, not a final conclusion.
art37.p2: (2) The Client agrees that each diagnostic step is necessary to properly establish the vehicle's technical condition.
art37.p3: (3) This chapter may be amended and supplemented at any time by the Service Center, and the amendment enters into force upon publication on the website.

xxv.title: Chapter XXV. Deadlines for Preparing a Quote

art38.title: Art. 38. General provisions
art38.p1: (1) After inspection and diagnostics, the Service Center prepares a repair quote describing required activities, parts, timelines, and costs.
art38.p2: (2) Preparing the quote is a process requiring time, attention, and consideration of the vehicle's technical complexity and interdependent systems.
art38.p3: (3) The Client accepts that the quote cannot be provided immediately and that the preparation period may be up to fourteen (14) calendar days from the date of vehicle inspection.

art39.title: Art. 39. Reasons for up to 14 days
art39.p1: (1) The quote preparation period is determined by:

reasons.1: Item 1. The need for staged diagnostics and checks of interconnected systems;
reasons.2: Item 2. The complexity of technical problems and need for additional tests;
reasons.3: Item 3. Processing of already submitted and pending quotes from other customers;
reasons.5: Item 5. Internal control and approval procedures.

art39.p2: (2) The Client accepts these factors are objective and do not constitute delay or non-performance, but part of the normal work process.

art40.title: Art. 40. Liability and limitations
art40.p1: (1) The Service Center is responsible for providing the quote within the stated period, except in force majeure circumstances.
art40.p2: (2) The Client may not claim compensation for the waiting period, as it is part of the normal work process.
art40.p3: (3) If the Client refuses to wait for the quote, the Service Center is released from any obligation to perform the repair.

art41.title: Art. 41. Additional provisions
art41.p1: (1) This policy aims to provide transparency and clarity regarding quote preparation timelines.
art41.p2: (2) The Client agrees that the quote preparation process is staged and depends on the vehicle's technical complexity and the Service Center's workload.
art41.p3: (3) This chapter may be amended and supplemented at any time by the Service Center, and the amendment enters into force upon publication on the website.
